basics.name: Jérôme Loisel
basics.label: Devops Software Engineer
basics.summary: Hi, i'm an experienced Devops Software with a strong background in concurrent large scale applications written in Java. I'm also a maker. I've developed Freeglobes.net in 2006, an open-source PHP/MySQL CMS. I founded OctoPerf.com mid-2014 with a friend, Gerald Pereira. I'm passionate and curious about new technologies, especially open-source. I like to read books on technical subjects like Concurrency, Algorithms and Design patterns.

work.summary: OctoPerf.com is an innovative Saas Load Testing Tool based on JMeter. Octoperf is based on a microservice architecture containerized with Docker. It scales to hundred of machines on-demand.
highlights: Market study and product management: study existing competitors and design an innovative solution which solves customer issues
Architecture: Design from the ground a scalable REST Api backed by microservices
Big Data: Deploy an Elastic Mesos Cluster per AWS region which scales Mesos-slave on-demand
Docker: Containerized backend architecture
Continuous Integration: One-click build & deploy REST Api server from Jenkins CI
Log Management: centralized log management using Loggly
Marketing: integration with third-party services like MailChimp, Sellsy
Payment: automated subscriptions using Stripe

work.summary: TapValue is a major actor in Real-Time Bidding advertising and retargeting. I helped to improve the existing code base and setup processes to speed up future developments.
highlights: Amazon AWS: operating comany's services on Amazon: EC2, Route53, CloudFront, S3, Elastic Beanstalk
Centralized Process Management Web UI based on Supervisord
Designing and operating high performance web application (500K req/min)
Real-time processing: replace Hadoop by Apache Spark running on an Apache Mesos Cluster
Clustering: operate company's web services on Mesos with Apache Marathon
Amazon AWS, Apache Mesos, Apache Spark, Apache Marathon, Spring, Maven, Java, Jenkins, Beanstalk

work.summary: Neotys helps companies create faster applications and deliver new features in less time using automated and collaborative load testing and performance monitoring across the application lifecycle. I was in charge of: - Design Functional and technical specifications. I have been one of the first developers joining the company. I really enjoyed solving hard problems involving concurrency and complex algorithms.
highlights: Distributed Rendezvous: synchronize the launch of thousands of virtual users accross an entire cluster to hit your application. Lock-free synchronization (Atomic) helped to achieve up to 2 millions virtual users launched at the same time by driving 300 machines.

Results Database optimization: achieve 40x greater read performances by using a Bucketing algorithm which reduces the amount of data to read, and multithreading to distribute the workload on multiple CPU cores.
Bandwidth limitation rewritten using Leaky Bucket algorithm and Guava's RateLimiter to simulate bandwidth limitation more accurately.
Add load-testing support for various binary Http protocols like Oracle Forms or Adobe Flex by reverse-engineering them. Create an API which allows to add more protocols later
Public API in Java available to customers to add their own binary protocol support
Automation: algorithm to automate extracting and injecting dynamic parameters (like session tokens) in load testing scenarios
Java 7, low level Socket, Multithreading, concurrency, Binary protocols (WebSocket, Oracle Forms, Adobe Flex /AMF), Swing, Maven.
